definition: to meet by chance (usually with misfortune)/classifier for events: time, turn, incident

sentences.english: The tiny village of Finley is said to possess a "cursed tree."
sentences.chinese: 据说芬里村这个小庄里有一棵“遭殃树”。

sentences.english: But it’s Georgia that is most likely to suffer from Putin’s return.
sentences.chinese: 但是，最有可能因为普京的回归而遭殃的是格鲁吉亚。

sentences.english: By contrast, rich nations suffer from deep sunk costs and entrenched vested interests.
sentences.chinese: 与之相比，富国将遭殃于深厚的隐没成本及既得利益。

sentences.english: Every man for himself, and the devil take the hindmost .
sentences.chinese: 人人顾自己，落后者遭殃。

sentences.english: When the fox preacheth, then beware your geese.
sentences.chinese: 每逢狐狸讲道，当心鹅儿遭殃。

sentences.english: When the fox preacheth,then beware your geese.
sentences.chinese: 每逢狐狸讲道，当心鹅儿遭殃。

sentences.english: Kings go mad, and the people suffer for it.
And when the family collapses it is the children that are usually damaged.
sentences.chinese: 当家庭解体时，往往总是孩子遭殃。

sentences.english: The poor nutrition is first of all suffered by our farmers.
sentences.chinese: 营养不良首先是让我们农民遭殃。

sentences.english: Two angry gods hurling boulders at one another while the ants scurry below.
sentences.chinese: 两个愤怒的上帝互殴，下面的蝼蚁就要遭殃了。

sentences.english: When the cat and mouse agree, the grocer is ruined.
sentences.chinese: 猫鼠一家亲，杂货店老板就遭殃。

sentences.english: It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
sentences.chinese: 使人人遭殃的风才是恶风。

sentences.english: The enemy soldiers fled and let the devil catch the hindmost.
sentences.chinese: 敌兵纷纷逃窜，听任后面的人遭殃。

sentences.english: The little business Parker had started soon peaked out.
sentences.chinese: 据说芬里村这个小庄里有一棵“遭殃树”。

sentences.english: Many pets are victims of overfeeding.
sentences.chinese: 许多宠物因喂食过量而遭殃。

sentences.english: The witch-doctor has cursed our cattle.
sentences.chinese: 巫医念了咒语想叫我家的牛遭殃。

definition: to have bad luck/to be out of luck
to involve/to implicate sb/to spread to others (harm, trouble, damage etc)

a fire in the city gates is also a calamity for the fish in the moat (idiom); the bystander will also suffer/fig. you can't escape responsibility for your actions/ask not for whom the bell tolls - it tolls for thee
pinyin: cheng2 men2 shi1 huo3 , yang1 ji2 chi2 yu2

definition: violent death (idiom); to die in a disaster/an unnatural death
the masses rise to attack it (idiom); Everyone is against the idea./universally abhorrent
